roleset.name: cf buy and sell, pay for, pay for again
roleset.note: PAYMENT-N NOTES: Based on sentences in nouns-00040. Comparison to pay.01. VN class pay-68. Framed by Katie. (from payment.01-n)
REPAYMENT-N NOTES: Based on noun entry payment.01. Corresponds to VN class pay-68. Framed by Claire. (from repayment.01-n)
PAID-J NOTES: Automatically created by Julia as an alias file for unification. (from paid.01-j)

role.descr: person being paid, destination of attention

example.name: price and commodity
example.text: Investors pay higher prices for country funds.

example.name: seller and purpose
example.text: Theatres pay movie producers for showing their films.

example.name: passive, price and receiver
example.text: [Mr. Cray]-1 was paid *trace*-1 $600,000 at Cray Research last year.

example.name: variant: pay on
example.text: The Latin American nation has paid very little on its debt.

example.name: agentive passive
example.text: ...[the TV commercial]-1 paid for *trace*-1 by Giuliani's campaign...

example.name: payer, payee, payment
example.text: The transaction would pay shareholders $55 a share.

example.name: pay attention
example.text: The media pays attention to Japanese investment

example.name: with MNR
example.text: in November and December alone, junk bond investors will receive $4.8 billion of coupon interest payments

example.name: args 0 and 2
example.text: Bally 's alleged greenmail payment to Mr. Trump

example.name: Arg 3 only
example.text: tax payments

example.name: args 0, 1, and 3
example.text: your final $2500 house payment

example.name: Light Verb!
example.text: It said it-1 needs *-1 to make the payment by Dec. 1 to avoid a default that could lead to an acceleration of the debt .

example.name: Within LVC
example.text: The agreement calls for South African debtors to make repayments in eight installments , starting in December of next year .
example.arg: starting in December of next year

example.name: All arguments
example.text: He conditioned it upon his repayment of $13795 to Mr. Crisman, Jr. for the expenses he incurred as guardian.
example.arg: for the expenses he incurred as guardian.

example.name: crime doesn't pay
example.text: ``It's not easy to roll out something that comprehensive, and make it pay,'' Mr. Jacob says.

roleset.name: pay off
roleset.note: PAYOFF_OFF-N NOTES: Automatically created by Julia as an alias file for unification. (from payoff.02-n)

example.name: chump change
example.text: The government paid off $13.8 billion in T-bills.

example.name: With arg 2
example.text: You could have the flip side and have some judge that-1 was paid *-1 off.

example.name: phrasal success
example.text: That can pay off down the road as customers, especially the younger ones, change from borrowers to savers/investors.
example.arg: as customers, especially the younger ones, change from borrowers to savers/investors

role.descr: person being paid, destination of attention

example.name: Arg0 rel Arg2 Arg3
example.text: Businesses are paying out a smaller percentage of their profits.
example.arg: a smaller percentage of their profits

example.name: bastard child of pay (debt) and pay off (debt)
example.src: bastard child of pay (debt) and pay off (debt)
example.type: bastard child of pay (debt) and pay off (debt)
example.text: But Mr. Wathen's team still must pay down about $82 million of long-term bank debt from the acquisition within the next four years.
example.arg: about $82 million of long-term bank debt from the acquisition

roleset.name: same as pay.01 but sounds tougher

role.descr: person being paid, given the money

example.name: Payer only
example.text: I knew that if I did n't pay up they would burn the car .

example.name: More arguments
example.text: A consumer court in Bangalore has asked [German airline Lufthansa]-1 *PRO*-1 to pay up compensation for a rude airhostess.
